Package mmj.pa

Class ProofStepStmt

java.lang.Object
mmj.pa.ProofWorkStmt
mmj.pa.ProofStepStmt
Direct Known Subclasses:
DerivationStep, HypothesisStep
public abstract class ProofStepStmt extends ProofWorkStmt
ProofStepStmt represents the commonalities of DerivationStep and HypothesisStep.

  • Constructor Details

    • ProofStepStmt

      public ProofStepStmt(ProofWorksheet w)
      Default Constructor.
      Parameters:
      w - the owning ProofWorksheet

    • ProofStepStmt

      public ProofStepStmt(ProofWorksheet w, String step, String refLabel, Formula formula, boolean setCaret)
      Constructor for incomplete ProofStepStmt destined only for output to the GUI.

      Creates "incomplete" ProofStepStmt which is destined only for output to the GUI, hence, the object references, etc. are not loaded. After display to the GUI this worksheet disappears -- recreated via "load" each time the user selects "StartUnification".

      Parameters:
      w - The owning ProofWorksheet
      step - step number of the ProofStepStmt
      refLabel - Ref label of the ProofStepStmt
      formula - the proof step formula
      setCaret - true means position caret of TextArea to this statement.

  • Method Details

    • getStep

      public String getStep()

    • setStep

      public void setStep(String step)

    • loadProofLevel

      public void loadProofLevel(int proofLevel)
      Loads the proofLevel number with the input proofLevel but only if the existing proofLevel is zero.

      Note: does not update a non-zero proofLevel because a step can be used more than once as an hypothesis, so different level numbers could result.

      Parameters:
      proofLevel - value to store if existing level is zero.

    • computeFieldIdCol

      public int computeFieldIdCol(int fieldId)
      Computes column number in the proof step text of the input field id.
      Specified by:
      computeFieldIdCol in class ProofWorkStmt
      Parameters:
      fieldId - value identify ProofWorkStmt field for cursor positioning, as defined in PaConstants.FIELD_ID_*.
      Returns:
      column of input fieldId or default value of 1 if there is an error.

    • tmffReformat

      public void tmffReformat()
      Reformats Derivation Step using TMFF.
      Specified by:
      tmffReformat in class ProofWorkStmt

    • computeFieldIdColRef

      public int computeFieldIdColRef()
      Function used for cursor positioning.

      The function looks for the Ref in the 2nd colon in the ProofWorkStmt.stmtText and sets the output column to the column *after* the 2nd colon -- but returns 1 if whitespace is found before the 2nd colon in the stmtText.

      Returns:
      column of Ref subfield in proof step of 1 if there is an error.

    • updateFormulaParseTree

      public void updateFormulaParseTree(ParseTree parseTree)
      Updates the ProofStepStmt ParseTree, resetting maxDepth and levelOneTwo data.
      Parameters:
      parseTree - the new ParseTree for the step.

    • accumSetOfWorkVarsUsed

    • updateWorkVarList

      public void updateWorkVarList(List<WorkVar> workVarList)
      Updates the workVarList for the ProofStepStmt and if the revised workVarList is null turns off the formulaFldIncomplete flag.
      Parameters:
      workVarList - List of WorkVar listing the WorkVar used in the step formula.

    • updateStmtTextWithWorkVarUpdates

      public boolean updateStmtTextWithWorkVarUpdates(VerifyProofs verifyProofs)
      Updates stmtText in place using substitution values assigned to work variables used in the step.

      NOTE: This is a dirty little hack :-) </p ?

      Parameters:
      verifyProofs - instance of VerifyProofs for use converting an RPN list to a formula.
      Returns:
      true if stmtText updated successfully.

    • loadStmtTextWithFormula

      public String loadStmtTextWithFormula(boolean workVarsOk) throws IOException, MMIOException, ProofAsstException
      Loads stmtText and formula fields with the input tokens.

      The formula is loaded and validated before Step/Hyp/Ref so that the formula symbols can be validated as they are read in. We return to validate Step/Hyp/Ref after doing the formula. The big problem being solved here is positioning the caret as accurately as possible to the first reported error on the line.

      Parameters:
      workVarsOk - indicator to allow/disallow WorkVar syms in this formula.
      Returns:
      String showing the proof text statement
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurred
      MMIOException - if an error occurred
      ProofAsstException - if an error occurred

    • hasMatchingRefLabel

      public boolean hasMatchingRefLabel(String ref)
      Function to determine whether the ProofWorkStmt Ref Label matches the input string (always false in base class.)
      Overrides:
      hasMatchingRefLabel in class ProofWorkStmt
      Parameters:
      ref - string to compare to ProofWorkStmt refLabel string.
      Returns:
      true if ProofStepStmt Ref label matches the input string.

    • hasMatchingStepNbr

      Compares input Step number to this step.
      Overrides:
      hasMatchingStepNbr in class ProofWorkStmt
      Parameters:
      newStepNbr - step number to compare
      Returns:
      true if equal, false if not equal.

    • setRefLabel

      public void setRefLabel(String refLabel)
      Sets the Ref label for the step.

      Note: refLabel is input first and Ref is derived, but for new Theorems, Ref may not exist, which is why we carry both around at all times.

      Parameters:
      refLabel - Ref label for the step.

    • reviseStepHypRefInStmtTextArea

      public static void reviseStepHypRefInStmtTextArea(StringBuilder textArea, StringBuilder newTextPrefix)
      Updates the first token of the text area.

      Assumes text already contains StepHypRef token.

      Objective is to avoid changing the position of the other tokens within the text area -- as much as possible.

      Parameters:
      textArea - step stmtText area or similar text area.
      newTextPrefix - revised first token of text area.

    • loadStmtText

      protected int loadStmtText(StringBuilder stepHypRef, Formula formula, ParseTree parseTree)
      Renders formula into stepHypRef string buffer and returns the number of lines in the formula. (This assumes that stepHypRef requires only one line, which, theoretically could be wrong!)
      Parameters:
      stepHypRef - the string buffer
      formula - the formula
      parseTree - of the Formula to be rendered. If left null, the formula will be output in unformatted
      Returns:
      number of lines in the formula

    • reloadStepHypRefInStmtText

      public abstract void reloadStepHypRefInStmtText()
      Updates the Step/Hyp/Ref field in the statement text area of the proof step.

      This is needed because Unify can alter Hyp and Ref.
